rComments: it's surprising to me that he teaches CHRISTIAN art, when he is so disrespectful to the Christian religion. it's unfortunate because i love the class material, and he can be funny at times, but he should tone down the disrespect.

Took two of Adam Cohen's classes: Medieval Art and Jewish Art, both were great! He clearly knows his stuff, especially in Medieval Art. Jewish Art is very theory-based, so you MUST read all the papers, even if it kills you. Medieval art you can get away with lectures alone. Hard marker, but both were amazing classes!!
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read', 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: He records his lectures, but not the parts when he speaks off-topic and makes rude and disrespectful jokes about monks and nuns. This is not professional behaviour from someone who teaches Christian art. He was only concerned about the Jewish students in the class and the medievalists.

Gives great feedback. If you put in the effort, you can improve your writing a good deal. Prefers to encourage students to figure things out on their own, but will give hints if you show that you're trying.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Loved him he was very clear and helpful, recorded lectures and posted them so you did not have to attend lecture, always made class fun and asskgnment was super easy.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Graded by few things', 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: He is an inspiring lecturer. You can tell he is passionate about the class and well-informed of its material. My only warning is the lectures may seem cramped, and he does not always follow the text book chapter by chapter. Expect to study 15-30 hours for finals and midterms, due to the volume of material. With work, an A is definitely possible.
Lacked coherent lecture structure.

Cohen is so incredibly funny which makes the class all the more interesting and awesome. I've never had so much fun in an art history course- he loves what he does which is something you see in every lecture you go to. He's such an awesome teacher you won't want to skip it

He uses lecture time ineffectively delivering material sporadically and slowly. Leaves you feeling uninformed and unsure of material. Unrealistic approach to exam asking you to identify unknown objects. Lowest mark I've received in my life for a course I truly applied myself to. Left me feeling frustrated in the realm of medieval art.
Prof. Cohen really pushes students to do their best. The difficulty increased gradually, and the assignments were interesting, though it would have been nice to write longer papers at the 400 level.
Great prof!
Amazing prof. If you are going to take one art history course at U of T, take Professor Cohen's classes, it's worth it!
Tons of readings but Professor Cohen classes were so much fun that it was worth it. Very supportive and helpful prof.
Great manuscript course!
Energetic lecturer
Too funny, he records his classes to post online, however you will never get the jokes if you don't attend!  If you go to class, you will do great in this class.
Interesting lectures. Great material. Unreasonable grades, unclear expectations. If you are concerned about maintaining high average avoid his courses
Great and engaging professor. Also, all lectures are video-recorded and posted online, which makes life so much easier!

One of the best profs. I had during my four years at U of T! You don't need to be an art history student to appreciate the material, and the way in which it was taught--he made it very accessible and entertaining. I never forgot anything in his lectures, which is a rarity, as most profs. drone on. I'm onto grad school in art history because of him!

It's obvious how much Prof Cohen loves his subject area, and its great to be taught by him.  Each lecture is like a documentary on discovery, he makes it seem like you're watching a show and not sitting in a classroom at Sid Smith.  Inspiring lecturer, its great being taught by people who love what they do.  Take a course by him you'll love it.

One of the best professors I had at U of T. Engaging, knowledgeable and extremely helpful, no student will come away disappointed with their 'university experience' if they take any of Professor Cohen's courses.

If you are thinking of studying with Prof. Cohen, be forewarned: you'll come out of the class an aspiring medievalist. Prof. Cohen is an excellent and very dedicated professor. He'll push you to work as hard as you can, but he'll give you all the help you need to do so. You will not regret taking one of his courses.
No Comments

I went into this course thinking medieval art was dull and unimaginative. I came out of this course wanting to specialize in it. Prof Cohen was clear, entertaining and really passionate about the subject. He is incredibly helpful and easy to approach. Definitely take any courses he teaches! You will not be disappointed.
Awesome prof! I can't believe I almost didn't take this course- even if Medieval art isn't your thing, he'll make you love it.  Don't want it to end.
FANTASTIC PROF!  Only good prof in the TERRIBLE fine art history department - the whole dept. needs an overhaul and new teachers!!!  Cohen is hot and his classes rock - take anything he teaches!!!

Prof. Cohen is a fabulous lecturer. His lectures are  like great anecdotes. He is funny and charismatic. IT is obvious he loves his job. Do yourself the favour and take his class, whatever the subject is he will make it interesting.
I love you very very very much Professor Cohen. YOu are the best professor I ever had. I love the way you teach in the class and your are very handsome as well.
I love you, Professor Cohen.  And you also made me love medieval art, which isn't an easy thing to do.  Clear, snappy, and fun...he even attempts hands-on learning on the Sid Smith porch!
Great Prof.  Clear and interesting lectures.    Makes you glad you took the course!
I love Prof. Cohen.  I'm energized after his lectures.  He knows tons of little interesting tidbits about everything he teaches and he's a funny guy.  A+
